channel.title: The Shackleton Expanse
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: USS Sekhmet
item.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse
Portrait:: Note:: Pulled back into service to supplement Starfleet's overextended fleet, the USS Sekhmet stands on guard over Narendra station and the Shackleton Expanse beyond. The USS Sekmet is a Columbia Class cruiser stationed at Narendra Station. After the bombings on the Mars Utopia Planitia shipyards, Starfleet supplemented it's fleet by pulling retired vessels back into service with substantial refits. The Sekhmet carries a crew of a little over 100 crewman and officers. Federation Starship Columbia Class Garbage Scow Sekhmet is the Egyptian goddess of war and medicine. The USS Sekhmet is the first of it's name, and was chosen to signal it's equal potential as a protector and threat.The USS Sekhmet, has been assigned to Narendra station as an emergency response and tactical strike starship. While Sekhmet has a regular crew, the Narendra Station provides a rotating roster of commanding officers due to stretched personnel resources and the Sekhmet's irregular mission schedule.Season 1
Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call: Stardate 67156, Session: 1The Sekhmet investgated a missing science team at Bacchus-3, only to get caught in the same subspace distortion wave and became stranded. On the planet, they found the team strange entranced by massive monoliths, even willing to die to get inside.
Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3: Stardate 67156, Session: 2The Sekhmet's away team ventured into the spire on Bacchus-3, and found a message from an unknown alien race. They asked the away team to find "the facility". They disabled the subspace distortion wave, and evacuated from the planet and the system, bringing wanted Klingon pirates with them.
Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You: Stardate 67197, Session: 3The Sekhmet assisted the USS Constantine in delivering a crucial agricultural exchange to a colony in the Bix system. The crew and passengers of the Constantine had succumbed to a neurotoxin produced by Ice Peas while not in it's natural habitat.
Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist: Stardate 67217, Session: 4The Sekhmet was sent to pursue an Orion freighter which had stolen the Bacchus Artifact. The chase lead to the Romulan neutral zone. Before the Sekhmet could tractor beam the freighter and head back to base, a Romulan Warbird decloaked. The Sekhmet disabled the freighter's shields, beamed the artifact aboard, and fled the neutral zone before the Warbird could break the Sekhmet's own shields.
Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision: Stardate 67233, Session: 5The Sekhmet made first contact with a new species made of crystal that communicated with refracted light. They crew assisted the aliens by removing an unidentified torpedo from the hull, and sent them on their way.
Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem: Stardate 67255, Session: 6The Sekhmet picked up Admiral Stoker and was ordered to Pasqual-1. There, they found a planet cloaked in an electromagnetic field that interfered with sensors and would disable and electronic equipment. It was covered in hundreds of strange black obelisks, 3 stories tall, and was home to a pre-industrial civilization.
Sekhmet Log 5.2 - Monoliths: Stardate 67255, Session: 7Val, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes explored Pasqual-1 and followed some locals back to a community built around a black monolith. They discovered that the monolith was performing genetic experiments and forcefully evolving the population, and then attempting to send it to the Seku system. The electromagnetic field seemed to be an unintended interaction of the monoliths and the planet's crust.
Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack: Stardate 67255, Session: 8When the away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the Sekhmet, it was under attack from a starship crewed by the Vinshari, a new civilization. Conrak and Val were able to work efficiently as a team and quickly disabled the starship. The Vinshari claimed that the Admiral had stolen from them, and demanded the Admiral be handed over to them to face justice. In the end, Admiral Stoker was arrested for attempting to destroy the Vinshari starship while it was defenseless.
Sekhmet Log 6 - Life and Soul: Stardate 67314, Session: 9The crew investigated a strange holodeck program found on Admiral Stoker’s shuttle. On it, they found a 1950’s super spy scenario in which Stoker had hidden detailed logs of her solo adventures in the Shackleton Expanse. They found them disguised as the blueprints for atomic weapons in the private mansion of German weapons dealer.
Sekhmet Log 7 - Border Dispute: Stardate 67333, Session: 10The USS Sekhmet was sent to rendezvous with the Nightingale but arrived to find it crippled by a Romulan Warbird inside the Neutral Zone. The Sekhmet launched a surprise attack and disabled the Warbird’s shields. During the battle, a Starfleet shuttle launched from the Nightingale and fled to the Romulans, forcing the Sekhmet to destroy it before it could escape. The pilot was revealed to be T’Lek, a Vulcan officer now presumed to be a traitor.
Sekhmet Log 8 - Order in Court: Stardate 67353, Session: 11Admiral Stoker faces a court martial for her actions at Pasqual-1 and is ultimately put medical leave on Earth until the wellbeing of her motivations and independence can be verified. Season 2
Sekhmet Log 9.1 - -Abyss Station: Stardate 67369, Session: 12The USS Sekhmet investigated the Omega Draconis system, discovering a neutronium station, a barren planet inhabited by the Ithik, and a rotating black hole with radiation jets threatening systems within 100 light years. One away team went to the planet and met the Ithik people who were waiting for the black hole to destroy their planet and ascend to a higher form of existence. On the station, another away team visited the station's engineering section and deactivated power to security systems. They then went up to the control room, which was held by a team of Vinshari.
Sekhmet Log 9.2 - Chaktir: Stardate 67369, Session: 13The Sekhmet’s away team captured the station control room after defeating a Vinshari squad and discovered that its cloning facilities had been producing successive generations of the people on the planet. On Chaktir, the crew struggled to persuade the Ithik ministers to evacuate, successfully swaying Temeran and Genji by reframing the black hole’s radiation surge as divine punishment rather than ascension. Meanwhile, Commander Val underwent a dangerous Ithik nanoprobe infusion.
Sekhmet Log 9.3 - When the Abyss Looked Away: Stardate 67369, Session: 14The away team failed to evacuate Chaktir, but the black hole jets were stopped in time. Mayor Akkara was accidentally beamed aboard and chose to stay. The crew departed the system, leaving the station intact but rigged to alert Starfleet.
Sekhmet Log 10 - Convoy SE-119: Stardate 68462, Session: 15The crew investigated the Bacchus Artifact and received a telepathic message before securing it behind a telepathic barrier. Later, during an escort mission through subspace eddies, the Sekhmet and a colonization convoy was ambushed by Vinshari pirates.
Sekhmet Log 10.2 - Ha'kiv: Stardate 68462, Session: 16The Sekhmet team fought off the remaining Vistani, but one ship escaped after harpooning a Federation freighter. They discovered a Vistani prisoner and a large slug-like creature used to power Vistani warp drives. Hoping to use the creature to trace the fleeing ship, the crew secured it, while Val began interrogating the prisoner.
Sekhmet Log 11.1 - Ambush: Stardate 68560, Session: 17Sekhmet tracked the Vinshari ships from the convoy raid as far as the Amaddon system, where Vinshari harpooned a feeding Ha’kiv and demanded the Sekhmet’s warp core. The crew refused, optimized defenses, and found shield frequency holes to strike back.
Sekhmet Log 11.2 - Boarded: Stardate 68576, Session: 18Sekhmet’s opening phaser strikes landed, but the Vinshari recovered, disabled the ship, harpooned it, and boarded. With the bridge under assault and Engineering collapsing, Val fell critically wounded as a Vinshari leader started hacking the console to jettison the warp core.
Sekhmet Log 11.3 - The Ar-Ka-Se: Stardate 68576, Session: 19The bridge crew repelled Vinshari boarders, then made a surprise attack to retake Engineering before the enemy could eject the warp core. After control was restored, Captain J’lara requested help and arrived with a Tilikaal science officer aboard the Sekhmet.

item.title: Skklarr
item.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 7 Rank:: Master Chief Petty Officer Type:: Player Character Status:: Enlisted Species:: Gorn Role:: Operations Manager
Portrait:: Note:: A Gorn raised by the overly cautious Kelpians, now working as an engineer on a frontier that's anything by safe. Value1:: my kingdom for some threat ganglia Value2:: give me a hyperspanner, and I can fix it Value3:: the captain may command her, but this ship is MINE Value4:: I'll use my fear to protect others
Sorran originally treating Skklarr like a curiosity.
Both Skklarr and Conrak accept violence as a necessary evil.
Conrak saved Skklarr from an EVA situation at wolf-359
Val talks to Skklarr about cross-cultural identity.
Su'Kra is Skklarr's sister.
Both Skklarr and Bov are obsessed with engineering and tinkering. Table4 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

Info Pronouns: he/him Rank: Lieutenant Species: Denobulan Role: Science Officer Portrait:: Note: An expert in hazardous material properties and disposal, with a contingency for every situation and a curiosity for every field of knowledge. Value1:: Optimism is Tactical Value2:: Every Discipline Has Something to Teach. Value3:: To Protect Life, I Must Understand What Threatens It. Value4:: Prepared for Anything, Expected or Not.
Constantly learning new things from Conrak, Sorran's gym partner.
Sorran once stopped Val from firing on a potential threat, in what turned out to be a first contact situation.
Shares an understanding of poly relationships with Val.
Sorran originally treated Skklarr like a curiosity.

Conrak consulted Val while working on his personal energy shield project.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the disappearance of a Starfleet science shuttle at the Bacchus system. When the Sekhmet arrived, it was violently thrown out of warp by a massive subspace distortion wave. With warp-speed rendered impossible and subspace communications completely washed out by background subspace frequencies in the system, they managed to push a probe far enough outside the system to get a distress signal out. Next, an away was sent down to Bacchus-3 to investigate the source of the distortion waves. A small coalition team of Starfleet and Klingon officers seemed entranced by the giant monoliths sticking out of the surface of the planet. Soon, the scientists opened the monoliths, revealing a facility on the inside. Two of the closest scientists threw themselves into the facility, getting vaporized instantly.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe Sekhmet's away team managed to retrain the remaining survivors on Bacchus-3 before they ran into the spire's interior. Val mind-melded with the science team's vulcan officer, and found a repeating message in his subconscious: "Find the facility." Sorran Vek found that D'Lok, a Klingon, at a brainwave resonating with the subspace distortion frequency.Conrak phasered one of the two phaser arrays guarding the entrance, which activated a security system closing the door. Conrak rushed forward and held the door open while Val disabled the second one. The away team entered the spire, leaving a small security team to guard the restrained scientists.Inside, the engineering specialist Victoria noted the amounts of power running through the spire was no enormous there were very few practical uses for it all. But it was enough power to punch wormholes through space-time. At the center of the spire, the found a control room with consoles for security, power management, subspace field generation, and more. They disabled the security system first, and then turned off the subspace field generator.An automated hologram projection of an alien introduced themselves as representing the "Displaced." The implored the group to find something called "The Facility" but didn't know where it was. It said its people were in peril and asked for the away team to go save them. It directed the away to to collect a bread-box sized sandstone prism with runes carved along the outside.The automated messenger finally urged them to leave quickly, because their ship would be in danger. The spires of Bacchus-3 was tractoring the nearest planet towards it, ripping the planet apart as it went. It was rebuilding a new Spire to replace the disabled one. A meteor shower threatened to destroy the Sekhmet and a disabled Klingon vessel. The away team and others on the surface returned to the Sekhmet.The Klingon vessel had arrived to find their "compatriots", and demanded to have them returned. Val convinced the Klingons that if they allowed the Sekhmet to tractor them out of the system to safety, then the fugitives would be returned, with an implication that they would be set free.However, the commanding officer Vrenta Ewasi instead ordered the Sekhmet to rendezvous with Starfleet vessels answering a distress signal. The Klingons were arrest, and the Sekhmet praised for not only saving the survey team, but also bringing in wanted criminals.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You
item.description: Table2 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterThe USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the USS Constantine, a Galaxy Class starship itself tasked with transporting an agricultural exchange from the Colony on Re-Alpha to a struggling colony on Bix. Aboard the Sekhmet, a boarding party found the crew of the Constantine acting strangely. The Executive officer ambushed the party, seemingly paranoid that they were intruders. The Captain was engaged in some sort of wrestling tournament, and various other crew members were exhibiting strong emotional reactions.The boarding party found the crew was under the effects of a neurotoxin called Wexylin-5C, which would cause different reactions from each person as a stress response. They tracked down the source of this neurotoxin to a plan on board called Ice Peas. The colonists had brought the crop on board and were sharing the food with the crew. The crop had been removed from it's natural habitat and was creating this neurotoxin in response to losing a particular fungus in it's soil. The boarding party was able to reintroduce the fungus into the Ice Pea bushes soil substitute, and bring the crew back to normal.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 2 - Peas to Meet You.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist
item.description: Table8 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterWhile Lt Sorran was studying the Bacchus artifact, Lt Kassandra Pruitt, suffered a massive neural failure cascade, sending her to the emergency room. Meanwhile the Artifact was stolen from the lab. Admiral Banna Stoker gave instructions to the Sekhmet to find it. The artifact could not be located on the station, and only 2 starships had left Narendra Station recently.The Sekhmet started by chasing down a Klingon Bird of Prey, who turned out to be innocent. This mistake meant an Orion Freighter made it all the way to the Romulan Neutral Zone before the Sekhmet caught up. In the neutral zone, they found the back end of the freighter caved in like an aluminum can, with some kind of gravity field compressing the ship's hull.Lt. Commander Val ordered the freighter to be hulled away with a tractor beam, but in the same moment a Romulan decloaked and caught the freighter in it's own tractor beam. This lead to a brief firefight. The Sekhmet disabled the Orion freighters shields and beamed the artifact aboard. The artifact was still attached to an Orion via a telepathic link which would kill him if removed forcefully.The the Orion freighter captain, Paljara, begged Val to send the artifact back, as it was ransom for her sister's life. Val refused to comply. The Romulan captain also threatened the Sekhmet, warning of dire consequences if the artifact and the Orion were not returned.In the end, the Sekhmet managed to charge it's warp drive and race back to Narendra station. Admiral Stoker commended the Sekhmet for a job well done. But as the Sekhmet retreated, the Romulans had destroyed the Orion freighter.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 3 - Orion Heist.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision
item.description: Table4 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterAfter Narendra Station picked up an unidentified object approaching the station at high warp speeds, the USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate while the station prepared for a potential attack. They found a strange crystalline starship and attempted rudimentary and cooperative communication with it.On board the crystal starship, the crew found an unidentified torpedo lodged into the side of the structure, seemingly made just for the purpose of attacking this kind of starship. As the hull of the ship seemed to be a living entity of some sort, an away team organized a surgical bomb disposal procedure to remove the torpedo safely. This triggered the torpedo to explode and it was sent into space with an emergency transport.Once the torpedo was removed, the strange crystal beings who communicated through light refraction departed back into the Shackleton Expanse.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 4 - Imminent Collision.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterSorran and Val were continuing investigation into Bacchus Artifact by performing controlled mind melds into it. However, the artifact's signal overloaded the failsafe meant to protect Val. It was deemed unsafe to continue these kinds of investigations. A shuttle was found rushing out of the Shackleton Expanse and towards the Sekhmet. Admiral Stoker was aboard and had taken damage as if in a firefight. When she boarded, she ordered the Sekhmet to head towards the Pasqual system in the Shackleton. Investigation into the shuttle revealed that she had indeed gotten into a fight with an unknown civilization. Her shuttle had visited several systems in the Shackleton.After cleaning up, Stoker briefed the crew on their mission: Pasqual-1 was an M-Class planet with a strange electromagnetic field shielding it from sensors. Stoker expected this planet might have remnants from the same civilization as Bacchus. The crew was also to keep a lookout for enemy ships that may have followed Stoker's shuttleAfter the briefing, Stoker took Conrak and Val aside and made it clear that the civilian Hik was to be enlisted into the Starfleet command structure or be removed from the ship's crew. Hik would be given a suitable position for her experience.The Sekhmet arrived at Pasqual-1 and found it covered in approximately 500 black obsidian monoliths, each about 3 stories tall. Each one had a small settlement build around it from a pre-industrial civilization.The Sekhmet put together an away team for Pasqual-1, and beamed down even through the electromagnetic interference. They aimed several kilometers outside a settlement and intended to work their way in to investigate the monolith there. In the woods, the away team was attacked by 4 panther-like predators, which were then killed or scared away.On the way to the nearest monolith, the away team followed a river until they found a woman and two children by a waterfall. They were doing laundry. Each one looked to be a different species than the others altogether.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 5.1 - The Pasqual Problem.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 5.2 - Monoliths
item.description: Table6 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterVal, Conrak, Sorren, and Karnes approached the three locals of Pasqual-1 at the waterfall. After making introductions, Val was able to mind meld with the locals to communicate. The woman introduced herself as Zumala, and the two children were Tadbon and Klopflim. Val hid their true origins from Zumala during the mind meld, but Zumala was able to sense him holding back information.The away team followed the three Pasqualese into their town, and were introduced to their elder, Jasper. Sorren and Val investigated the monolith in the center of town while Conrak acquainted himself with the locals.During a shared dinner outdoors, the monolith lit up in blue lights and 12 people around it fell to the ground, convulsing as it electrocuted. The people of the village seemed worried about it, but expected it to happen.Val convinced Jasper to bring them underneath the monolith, which Jasper considered holy ground. But in the mind meld, Jasper gleaned that the away team with from the stars and interpreted that as the team being angels. He asked them to bring him with them to the stars and Val agreed (at least temporarily.)Underneath the monolith, the away team found a control room. After some investigation, they discovered the control room was attempting to send genetic information from the community out to the Seku system in the Shackleton Expanse. They also found that every 6 months or so, the tower would send a signal out to several members of the community to revise their DNA, and then their children would be born with new features.With this information, the away team decided to return to the transport pickup spot. They brought Jasper, but Jasper was left behind as they were beamed back onto the Sekhmet. The Sekhmet was in red alert, and under attack.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe away team on Pasqual-1 returned to the USS Sekhmet to find it under attack. Conrak and Val rushed to battle stations on the bridge where Admiral Stoker and Captain Vrenta were keeping things under control so far.The enemy ship was a strange slender design with masts holding up sails. It fired weapons with physical projectiles with surprising effectiveness. Conrak and Val coordinated to return fire quick, dealing some damage to its shields. The Enemy fired a harpoon, which pierced a hole in the shielding and began draining energy from the Sekhmet's hull. Bov organized an emergy response team to dislodge the harpoon.The enemy ship retreated behind the planet and came swinging around the other side, but Conrak and Val were ready for them. Bov diverted Reserve power to the weapons and Conrak disabled their shield. Then Val ordered a torpedo to be fired. Admiral Stoker doubled down on the order and asked for a full salvo of torpedoes, enough to completely obliterate the enemy ship. Conrak did fire a Salvo but intentionally missed with several of the torpedoes.Captain Vrenta stood up against the admiral, saying that firing on a defenseless ship was ground to arrest the Admiral, and that's exactly what happened. Further, the bridge crew from the enemy vessel was beamed onto the Sekhmet and arrested for interrogation. They had blood red skin and high collar bones. They called themselves the Vinshari.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 5.3 - Vinshari Attack.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 6 - Life and Soul
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterAs Star Fleet prepared for Admiral Stoker’s trial, Bov and Val were picking apart her shuttle, looking for hidden evidence. They found a holodeck program, created on the shuttle itself during her solo excursion into the Shackleton Expanse.The program was a pulpy 1950's themed spy mission, where the party was tasked with recovering atomic bomb blueprints from a German weapons dealer named Mr. Halgrave.Halgrave was hosting a birthday party, where multiple other people were trying to acquire the plans. Most of the other guests were invited by Halgrave for his supposed birthday party. But Allied intelligence suspected the party was cover for an auction.At the party, Halgrave was no where to be seen. But the crew met with several would-be buyers at the auction. Val spoke with some of the guests along with Bov and Relek Tovan, trying to guess what Stoker's intention was. Meanwhile, Conrak infiltrated the upper floor and found a stockpile of machine guns. Security guards arrived and Conrak took them all out.In the ballroom, Val through a explosive pen at Halgrave, injuring him. Conrak was able to finish Hagrave off and took a key off the body. The key opened Halgrave's office, which had the atomic weapons blueprints on themBut the blueprints were not blueprints at all. Instead, there was a large conspiracy board full of logs, maps, and other data pertaining to Stoker’s solo adventure into the Shackleton Expanse, including a star map of suspected “Facility” locations and first-contact conversations with people calling themselves Akaru and Vinshari. In these conversation, Stoker attempted to threaten these new civilizations with the power of the Federation unless they revealed any ancient alien artifacts or facilities on their planets.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 6 - Life and Soul.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 7 - Border Dispute
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe USS Sekhmet was sent to rendezvous with the USS Nightingale to investigate what Admiral Stoker had done there before going into the Shackleton expanse.The Nightingale was a survey ship that had done a pass into the Shackleton Expanse along a long patrol. They were currently doing a sweep along the Romulan Neutral Zone.Before the Sekhmet could arrive, the Nightingale unexpectedly veered into the neutral zone. They were attacked by a Romulan Warbird, which disabled the ship and killed half their crew, with another 25% severely injured.However, the Romulans claimed to have taken a hit to their shields and were performing repairs before they would take the Nightingale and its crew as prisoners of war.The Sekhmet arrived and managed to disguise it's arrival in a nebula. From here they observed the scene. The Romulan Warbird was not truly damaged. The Sekhmet's crew assumed the Romulans may be recovering an agent or or asset.The Sekhmet launched a surprise attack against the Warbird, and managed to truly disable it's shields with a torpedo salvo and then move into a position to protect the Nightingale. The Warbird attempted to defend itself and repair it's shields, but it was too late.In the middle of the fight, a shuttle departed from the Nightingale careening towards the Warbird. It moved fast enough that the Sekhmet was unable to capture it in a tractor beam, and retreated into the wings of the Warbird. With no other way to stop the shuttle and fears that critical information could get into Romulan hands, the Sekhmet fired upon the shuttle itself destroying it and killing it's only crew member.The Romulan Warbird hailed the Sekhmet and said its goodbyes. It was none other than Sub-Commander Thal'vaek.With the Romulans taken care of, the Sekhmet performed basic repairs and relief for the survivors on the Nightingale. Their computers had been disabled by their captain using the Romulan Protocal, and a supposed Vulcan Starfleet Lieutenant named T'Lek had been working to restore them to assist with repairs. However, soon after computers were back online, during the fight, the T'Lek took the shuttle to the Romulans. It's currently unknown what intel T'Lek intended to give to Thal'vaek.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 7 - Border Dispute.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 8 - Order in Court
item.description: Table6 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting Character Yeoman Himari prosecuted, and led by accusing the Admiral of going outside Starfleet regulations and ignoring the normal chain of command.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 8 - Order in Court.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 9.1 - -Abyss Station
item.description: Table7 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe USS Sekhmet arrived in the Omega Draconis system after Admiral Stoker's hint to look into it. The black hole's radiation jets were rotating to align with the galactic plane, threatening any number of systems within 100 light years. Long range scans estimate that the rotation started just a few weeks ago.In the system, they found the neutronium space station, the black hole, and a single barren planet with 300 life signs on it. They also found a Vinshari ship with a skeleton crew in the system, and chased it away. One away team went to the only planet in the system, and another went to the neutronium station, suspecting that the station may be controlling the wormhole.On the planet, the away team met a species called the Ithik, who seemed to worship the black hole, awaiting the day that it would "turn it's gaze towards them. They were interpreting the rotation of the radiation jets of their final rapture. They away team was shown the Ithik meditation chambers, The Sekhmet team discovered signs of extreme danger and turned their focus to the station orbiting nearby.The station's away team headed first to engineering, where they found a suite of singularity engines powering the station’s systems. Most of the output was being funneled into controlling the black hole itself, but subsystems also supported wormhole generation, advanced security, and a vast cloning facility. To prioritize recovery efforts, the crew diverted energy away from security and into the cloning bays, activating approximately 300 stasis pods on the station.The team then moved to the control room, where they found Vinshari operatives already inside, presumably attempting to seize the station’s technology. This set the stage for a confrontation over control of the station and its powerful systems, while the greater danger of the black hole’s shifting radiation remained unresolved.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 9.2 - Chaktir
item.description: Table4 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe USS Sekhmet continued its mission in the Omega Draconis system, focusing on both the neutronium station and the Ithik colony on Chaktir. On the station, the away team staged an ambush around the control room, surrounding the Vinshari from multiple angles and catching them by surprise. Lt. Conrac led the charge, using his Numgo Teeka bostaff-like weapon to knock out most of the Vinshari singlehandedly. Their leader, a woman wielding holo-emitter batons, created illusions and false walls before trapping herself in a force field once her team was defeated.With the control room secured, the team analyzed the station’s systems further and confirmed that its technology was producing successive generations of the Ithik people living on Chaktir. Meanwhile, on the planet, the away team worked to convince the Ithik to evacuate ahead of the black hole’s shifting radiation jets. Through Minister Temeran, they framed the event as a divine punishment rather than an ascension, sowing doubt in the religious prophecy. While Temeran and Gengi began to waver, the Minister of Astronomy remained unconvinced.Elsewhere, Commander Val experienced a strange compulsion to seek out "The Facility", eventually visiting Minister Vodlin, the Minister of Wellbeing. They offered an infusion of Ithik nanoprobes, so Val submerged in a tank of nanite-rich gel, resisting multiple attempts by the swarm to seize control of his body and mind. Val emerged transformed but stable. The away team prepared for a final confrontation with Mayor Akkara, with only limited time remaining to convince him to evacuate his people before the black hole’s radiation surge reached the planet.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 9.3 - When the Abyss Looked Away
item.description: Table6 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe crew of the Sekhmet failed to convince the Ithik people of Chaktir to evacuate. Radiation jets from the nearby black hole came dangerously close, but were stopped at the last moment by the station team. As the tremors subsided, Mayor Akkara realized his people’s long-awaited ascension was never coming. Enraged, he sealed the shuttle bay and tried to trap the away team.The crew managed to beam out the shuttle and themselves simultaneously to avoid cultural contamination. As the Ithik watched the golden transporter beam, they believed the visitors were ascending and Akkara leapt into the beam. Once aboard the Sekhmet, he begged to stay, shaken by the collapse of his faith. The crew decided returning him would cause more harm than good, and allowed him to remain aboard.Before leaving the system, the crew installed a tripwire in the station’s shuttle bay. If the Vinshari return, Starfleet will be alerted. With no time left and the mission complete, the Sekhmet warped out of Omega Draconis.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 9.3 - When the Abyss Looked Away.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 10 - Convoy SE-119
item.description: Table5 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe crew of the Sekhmet welcomed two new additions to the roster: Tennan Li and Daoloth. Vrenta Ewasi interviewed Tennan Li and questioned him about his demotion. He also gave Val Permission to further investigate the Bacchus Artifact on the condition that Daoloth be able to supervise.To study the artifact, they constructed a telepathic field scanner to analyze the object’s field emissions. The device returned a simple message: “Hello? Is anyone there?” A containment system was quickly established by adding a telepathic barrier to isolate the artifact’s influence.Later, Narendra Station prepared an escort mission through a region filled with subspace eddies. A convoy of federation civilian colonization transports required safe passage, and the Klingon Defense Force committed a bird-of-prey to assist.Halfway to their destination, the Bird of Prey was disabled by a subspace eddie that overloaded its nacelle. As a repair team with Daoloth, Tovan, Val, and Sklarr made way in a shuttle to the bird of prey, two Vinshari Maelstrom starships appeared as if from no where and deployed a dozen single fighter ships. In the ensuing skirmish, Daoloth transmitted enemy shield frequencies to the Sekhmet and Bird of Prey, Tennan desperately avoided enemy fire, and Conrak launched a torpedo salvo that took out half the enemy fighters.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 10 - Convoy SE-119.md

item.title: Sekhmet Log 10.2 - Ha'kiv
item.description: Table4 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe Sekhmet engaged the last of the Vistani pirates to defend the convoy. One Vistani warship was destroyed, but another managed to harpoon a civilian ship and escape at warp. While combing the wreckage, the crew discovered a drifting shuttle with a single surviving Vistani, who was brought aboard and detained for questioning.In the wreckage of one of the destroyed Vistani ships, the team discovered a massive, 20-meter-long slug-like organism. The creature had pearlescent skin, tentacle-like appendages, and appeared to be used by the Vistani to power their ships. While not clearly sentient, it demonstrated advanced animal intelligence.Sorran and Conrak worked together to carefully free and capture it using a non-harmful tractor beam system. The team hoped to use the creature to help track the warp signature of the fleeing Vistani freighter.Meanwhile, Val initiated an interrogation of the Vistani prisoner to learn more about the slugs, the stolen freighter, and where the fleeing ship might have gone.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 11.1 - Ambush
item.description: Table6 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterAfter fending off Vinshari raiders, the Sekhmet left the colony convoy with Captain Akul and pursued the Vinshari ships that abducted a Federation freighter. Soren and Tawny tracked the Ha’kiv residue the raiders shed during their escape and picked up a repeating subspace distress signal. The trail led to the Amaddon system, where the crew observed two Ha’kiv—massive space slugs—feeding in a gas giant’s upper atmosphere. Moments later, two large Vinshari ships arrived, harpooned a Ha’kiv like whalers, and hailed the Sekhmet demanding its warp core, claiming “energy is our right.”The Sekhmet refused, ducked behind a planet, and tuned defenses: hull polarization and shield recalibration to blunt Vinshari fire. Tactical then isolated two frequency gaps in the Vinshari shields, setting up clean opening shots. Engagement was imminent, with one objective clear: protect the Ha’kiv and recover the stolen freighter’s trail without losing the ship.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 0 - Session 0
item.description: Stardate: https://www.route56.com/fan-fiction/stardate-calculator/

item.title: Sekhmet Log 11.2 - Boarded
item.description: Table6 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterThe Vinshari moved to strike, so the Sekhmet swung around a gas giant and opened with phaser arrays. Initial volleys punched breaches in Vinshari communications and hull using the identified frequency holes, but the Vinshari patched them and counterattacked. Their return fire collapsed the Sekhmet’s shields, disabled the ship, and they harpooned the hull. Boarding parties hit the hull and started cutting in. Captain Vrenta sent a security team to hold Engineering and another to reinforce the bridge.In Engineering, Val, Carnes, Bov, and Hick led the defense with a security detail. The Vinshari cut through the deck and opened fire. Val ordered phasers set to kill. Carnes was knocked out in melee, Hick went down to a holoemitter weapon, and Bov was dropped then revived by Val before Val was critically shot and left bleeding. A Vinshari leader entered, went straight to the engineering console, and began hacking it to release the warp core.

item.title: Sekhmet Log 11.3 - The Ar-Ka-Se
item.description: Table8 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNewCharactersTypeNon-Player CharacterTypePlayer CharacterTypeSupporting CharacterVinshari boarders hit the bridge. The team fought back but briefly lost control of the ship as the Vinshari deployed mechanical spiders to hack the bridge consoles. Tennan overloaded his own console to blast off mechanical spiders. Evi in sick bay was able to remotely send a specific frequency that knocked sveral Vinshari unconcious.With Engineering silent and time running out, Conrak and Vrenta weighed ejecting the warp core or even scuttling the ship. They chose neither. They beamed into the upper tier of Engineering and opened a surprise attack on the Vinshari below. The boarders fought back, but their leader failed to finish the hack needed to eject the core, and the Sekhmet retook Engineering.In the aftermath, Captain J’lara hailed from the Vinshari shuttle who had aided them in the starship conflict before. Her Ha’kiv had been stolen and she needed transport and aid. She beamed aboard with her science officer Thaccin. Thaccin was a tall, blue-skinned figure with a horned halo: A Tilikaal.
item.guid: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 11.3 - The Ar-Ka-Se.md

item.title: Bernard Johnson
item.description: Info Pronouns: he/him Rank: Lieutenant Species: Human Role: Transport Chief Portrait:: A simple guy who likes what he knows. Content within the confines of The Sekhmet transporter room. However he's eager and ready to serve in anyway possible. Table2 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

item.title: Daoloth
